Legal_Issue: Whether the RPD's decision was based on erroneous findings of fact
Credibility_Assessment: Credibility findings reviewed for patent unreasonableness; one finding on employment history deemed patently unreasonable, others upheld
Basis_of_Claim: Perceived lack of credibility and numerous inconsistencies in testimony
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Credibility of applicant, presence of inconsistencies in testimony
Proceeding_Type: Administrative hearing, followed by judicial review
Application_Error: One patently unreasonable finding regarding employment history
Review_Outcome: Application dismissed; RPD decision upheld overall
Assessment_Standard: Patent unreasonableness standard applied to credibility findings
Legal_Standard: Standard of patent unreasonableness for credibility assessments
Application_Factor: Analysis of eight alleged inconsistencies, four examined in detail
Decision_Review_Issue: Erroneous findings of fact affecting credibility
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Credibility findings must not be patently unreasonable
Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of credibility, inconsistencies in testimony
Procedural_Fairness: Tone of decision criticized as harsh but did not compromise fairness
Credibility_Issues: Multiple inconsistencies in testimony, particularly around employment history
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Judicial review challenging patent unreasonableness of credibility findings
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), case law on standard of review
Procedural_Issue: Scope and application of judicial review in administrative decisions
